author: Ted Byrne
content:
My Dad, Roland, was born in 1902. That was before: computers, CDs, satellites, breast implants, moon trips, tape recording, TV, radio, Asimov, Bradbury, and human winged flight! 
Once I asked him, "How'd you cope with all of that?"
"Well Ted," he smirked, "I just got up in the morning. Still do. How about you?"
